page.title: 04Customs in Caerhun Parish
page.content: Church and Chapel attendance is a custom in this area and there are many associated festivals such as Harvest Festival or Thanksgiving or Diolchgarwch as it is called in Welsh. A singing festival, Cymanfa Ganu, still has great appeal. It is a custom for friends and neighbours to visit bereaved families to offer sympathy and help. A village Carnival is held annually in July and a supervised bonfire on November 5th to celebrate Guy Fawkes is still a popular custom. Among the children the Hallowe'en customs of witches, making turnip lanterns and playing 'bob apples' still prevail. On New Years Day children call at houses chanting 'Calennig' or 'Blwyddyn Newydd Dda' - 'Happy New Year' - and receive a small gift.
